epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete including footpaths, slabs, foundations, normal class concrete
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m3 of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to and from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials
Generation of electricity from primary and secondary energy resources
core_processes: External transportation of materials to core processes and internal transport
Manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck)
Treatment of waste and wastewater from manufacturing
downstream_processes: Installation of ready-mix concrete on site
Transport and treatment of waste at end of life
system_boundaries.other_environmental_information: Module D indicates environmental benefits from reuse, recovery, and recycling of deconstructed concrete

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; pouring from truck and pump; manual finishing; no pre-installation activities modelled

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete during use stage onward
carbonation.note: CO2 absorption not considered in this EPD and not reflected in results

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 allocation rules
